intro: Cephalophyllum pallens, commonly known as the pale-headed candelabra, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its unique, branching structure that resembles a candelabra. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in the summer months, adding a delicate beauty to its spiny stems. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water requirements. Its distinctive appearance and resilience make it a notable species in botanical studies.
